creator: GNA

This was part of the Ghana Football Association‚Äôs effort to reshape the senior side to its glory days and also prepare them for [‚Ä¶] News Ghana, Latest Updates and Breaking News of Ghana, GNA, https://newsghana.com.gh/black-queens-begin-camping-ahead-of-two-international-friendlies/
newsArray.content: Nora Hauptle, Head Coach of Ghana‚Äôs senior female side, Black Queens has begun training with thirty-four selected players at the Ghanaman Soccer of Excellence ahead of friendlies against Benin and Togo respectively. This was part of the Ghana Football Association‚Äôs effort to reshape the senior side to its glory days and also prepare them for international competitions. The players were taken through an intensive training session in Prampram to keep up with their fitness level and also learn some tactical skills going into the clash against their West African opponents. The players were made up of both foreign-based players and some local players selected from the 20 Premier League clubs in Ghana. Black Queens would depart Accra on Friday to Cotonou as they face Benin on February 19, 2023, after which they would take on Togo on February 25, 2023. The selected players are Abdulai Salamatu, Acheampong Juliet, Achiaa Anasthesia, Adubea Princella, Alhassan Adama, Amponsah Ophelia, Anima Naomi, Animah Grace, Appiah Martha, Asantewaa Grace, Atovor Edem, Evelyn Badu, Boaduwaa Doris, Boakye Portia, and Bugre Azumah. The rest are Buoadu Grace, Darkwaa Veronica, Egyir Janet, Eshun Linda, Fuseini Salamatu, Haruna Zeinab, Issaka Lauratu, Konlan Cynthia, McCarthy Kerrie, Nyame Mafia, Nyamekye Stella, Osei Victoria, Osei Gifty, Owusu Jacqueline, Owusu Princess, Salifu Safiatu, Teye Suzzy Dede, Tuah Perpetual and Yakubu Fiduos.

newsArray.title: Bad Business: Orlando Pirates really fumbled the Lyle Foster bag
creator: James Freemantle
newsArray.description: Orlando Pirates missed out on a huge financial windfall when Lyle Foster secured his record-breaking switch to Burnley. Here are the details.
newsArray.content: Orlando Pirates missed out on a massive windfall when Lyle Foster secured his big-money move to Burnley. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at the situation. RIVAL WATCH: Kaizer Chiefs to be haunted by one of their own? ICYMI: Lyle Foster officially the most expensive South African footballer in history Orlando Pirates miss massive Lyle Foster windfall The fee that Burnley paid to Belgian side Westerlo for Foster‚Äôs services could rise to ‚Ç¨10 million. That depends on whether the Clarets secure promotion to the Premier League, but it‚Äôs looking good for Vincent Kompany‚Äôs side. So, how did the Buccaneers miss out on a chunk of that cash? PSL: Predicting the Orlando Pirates XI vs Maritzburg LOL: Five things that didn‚Äôt exist when Kaizer Chiefs last won a trophy Pirates fumbled the bag big time According to FIFA rules, a club that developed an U23 player is obliged to accrue a payment for every international transfer that the player makes. Pirates waived their share of future sell-on fees in the case of Lyle Foster, however, when the now 22-year-old moved to Monaco back in 2019. The Ligue 1 Principality side paid R20 million for Foster back then, which is a tiny proportion of the ‚Ç¨10 million (R194 million) that Burnley shelled out for the talented Bafana striker. The Pirates board will be having sleepless nights over that decision. An elementary business mistake really. ONCE ALWAYS: Proof that Lyle Foster will always be an Orlando Pirates fan ICYMI: Three Orlando Pirates players that Kaizer Chiefs fans would love to sign What are your thoughts, Bucs fans? For more insights, analysis and love for the beautiful game, hit up James Freemantle. Meanwhile, follow The South African on Twitter for up-to-the-minute news updates.

newsArray.title: Kaizer Chiefs to be haunted by one of their own?
creator: James Freemantle
newsArray.description: Kaizer Chiefs will be praying that they don't get eliminated from the Nedbank Cup by one of their own. A big decision has been made.
newsArray.content: A Kaizer Chiefs loanee eligible to play for Casric FC in the Nedbank Cup last 16 against his parent club. Could that spell danger for Amakhosi? LOL: Five things that didn‚Äôt exist when Kaizer Chiefs last won a trophy THROWBACK: Top stars to play for both Kaizer Chiefs and Orlando Pirates Amakhosi influence at Casric is strong Casric FC are one of the most exciting teams in the second tier of South African football. They‚Äôre clearly benefiting from the loan system which has seen them acquire a number of Kaizer Chiefs stars on a temporary basis. ‚ÄúTough one, it‚Äôs going to be an interesting one, but very good for football, I think the Nedbank Cup is giving all clubs an opportunity even in the lower divisions, talented players get to be seen and spotted by big teams,‚Äù coach Arthur Zwane said at Naturena on Thursday. Former Chiefs Head of Development Sundra Govinder is performing admirably alongside co-owner and head coach Bucs Mthombeni. Assistant duo Thabo Nthethe and Paulus Masehe are also chipping in. This technical team has propelled Casric to the summit of the NFD table with promotion to the PSL now a realistic dream. THROWBACK: Three Kaizer Chiefs youngsters destined for greatness Kaizer Chiefs keen to see Sifama progress It‚Äôs no surprise to see the likes of Kgotso Molope and loanee Sifama excelling with Casric, such is the high-quality environment surrounding them. iDiski Times have confirmed that Chiefs will not block Sifama from facing them in the Nedbank Cup, and Zwane has reiterated that. He‚Äôs excited to see Sifama evolve as a footballer but isn‚Äôt underestimating the task at hand. ICYMI: Pitso Mosimane has bigger fish to fry than Kaizer Chiefs flop Khama Billiat ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great for the country and for the league itself, so yeah it‚Äôs going to be a very difficult game for us ‚Äì they are number one as we speak, so that alone tells you they are a good team, they are not there by mistake,‚Äù the Amakhosi coach continued in praise of Casric. ‚ÄúPeople might see it as a team that‚Äôs easy to beat but no we will have to dig deep again because they have hard runners when you look at their team, very difficult to play against. ‚ÄúSo apart from the players we loaned to them, they are just a good team, we won‚Äôt take them for granted and we will need to show our superiority. They will play against us.‚Äù RIVAL WATCH: Predicting the Orlando Pirates XI vs Maritzburg Amakhosi fans will be delighted to see young Sifama progressing and maturing as a goal-scorer. However, they might not enjoy it so much if he‚Äôs the one to eliminate them from the Nedbank Cup this season. Thoughts, Chiefs fans? For more insights, analysis and love for the beautiful game, hit up James Freemantle. Meanwhile, follow The South African on Twitter for up-to-the-minute news updates.

newsArray.title: ALM derby violence no distraction for Victory, City
creator: Shayne Hope
newsArray.description: Melbourne Victory coach Tony Popovic and Melbourne City counterpart Rado Vidosic say their players are focused ahead of an A-League Men derby.
newsArray.content: Arch-rivals Melbourne Victory and Melbourne City insist they have moved on from the darkest day in A-League Men history as they prepare to lock horns for the first time since December's violent pitch invasion. The round-eight derby was abandoned after just 21 minutes as fans stormed the AAMI Park pitch during an emotion-charged fixture amid protests against the A-Leagues' controversial decision to play grand finals in Sydney for the next three years. Referee Alex King was injured and a television cameraman was hurt when struck by a flare, while City goalkeeper Tom Glover suffered concussion and lacerations to the face when hit with a metal bucket. The drama has cast a dark shadow over last-placed Victory's horror campaign, with $550,000 in fines and crowd restrictions among the sanctions handed down by Football Australia. The threat of a 10-point deduction - to be imposed if there is further crowd trouble within the next three-and-a-half seasons - still hangs over the club ahead of Saturday night's clash at AAMI Park. "No one's ignoring it (but) we've all moved on from that," Victory coach Tony Popovic said. "I don't know if the players are speaking about it internally but we're not addressing it as a group. "We're happy to see our fans and members back, (and) we want that to continue." City led December's derby through a well-crafted Aiden O'Neill goal before the match was called off. They have since gone on to build a commanding eight-point lead over Central Coast at the top of the table, with a game in hand, and coach Rado Vidosic is adamant his players are focused on the task at hand. "We are not going to talk about the 'memorable' things," Vidosic said, in reference to the pitch invasion. "We will show some of the clips from the (previous derby) game, some of our attacking combination play. We scored a beautiful goal. "We had several other good opportunities in the first 20 minutes but also they had a couple of chances as well. "It's a derby, the form and position on the table never really make a big difference. It's going to be who does better on the day." Victory have managed just one win in eight matches since the abandoned derby but four fresh faces brought in during the transfer window have boosted hopes of a turnaround in fortunes. Damien Da Silva, Connor Chapman and Bruce Kamau all featured in last week's defeat away to Newcastle and could be joined by Fernando Romero in the side to face City. The Paraguyan striker - on loan from Primera Division outfit Cerro Porteno - is a chance to make his Victory debut off the bench as Popovic urges his side to use the derby as a springboard back into finals contention. "We feel we're very close to turning this," Popovic said. "There's no better night or no better game to do it than in a derby. "We're up against the best (and) that's a fantastic challenge. We know we're good enough to win the game. "Instead of talking about it, we have to show it in our performance. "If we bring out the best performance I think we can really show Melbourne City what a good team we are." Sign up for our emails

newsArray.title: WAFL 2023: Perth chase former Geelong midfielder Quinton Narkle as Essendon, Richmond VFL also in the hunt
creator: Mitchell Woodcock
newsArray.description: Perth are competing against two VFL sides for the signature of former Geelong midfielder Quinton Narkle after he did not get a spot on Richmond‚Äôs list.
newsArray.content: Perth are competing against two VFL sides for the signature of former Geelong midfielder Quinton Narkle after he did not get a spot on Richmond‚Äôs list. Narkle, 25, trained with the Tigers over the summer but was overlooked in favour of country forward Kaelan Bradtke, who was also set to play for Perth if he did not get a gig in the AFL. The AFL‚Äôs Supplementary Selection Period closed on Wednesday, meaning Narkle must now wait until the mid-season draft to add to his 41 games for the Cats. Staff writers Craig O'Donoghue The West Australian understands both Richmond and Essendon‚Äôs VFL sides want Narkle to play for them this season, with the midfielder weighing up his future based on his family. ‚ÄúQuinton came back from the Christmas break in career-best condition and impressed us with his character and commitment to our program,‚Äù Richmond national recruiting manager Matt Clarke said. ‚ÄúUnfortunately we did not have two spots available, so we needed to make a very hard decision. He couldn‚Äôt have done any more during his time training at the club.‚Äù Meanwhile, troubled former AFL star Sydney Stack is committed to playing for the Demons, having hit the track in their past eight sessions. Stack, 22, is set to be an important part of the Demons‚Äô midfielder in 2023 as they seek a return to finals under new coach Peter German. Perth have also denied reports Sam Stubbs is unlikely to play for them in 2023, saying they‚Äôre off the mark. Stubbs has met with the club twice this week and is set to be at the club on Friday night after missing out on a spot on Fremantle‚Äôs list this year after training with them all summer. There were reports Stubbs did not want to play for Perth and even could play amateurs, but a Demons official shot them down and said the forward was committed to the club. Sign up for our emails

newsArray.title: Again, Partey may miss Arsenal‚Äôs clash with Aston Villa
creator: Guardian Nigeria
newsArray.description: Arsenal Manager, Mikel Arteta, has not given a return date for Thomas Partey after the midfielder missed out on Arsenal‚Äôs defeat to Manchester City with an injury. The post Again, Partey may miss Arsenal‚Äôs clash with Aston Villa appeared first on The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News.
newsArray.content: Arsenal Manager, Mikel Arteta, has not given a return date for Thomas Partey after the midfielder missed out on Arsenal‚Äôs defeat to Manchester City with an injury. The 29-year-old is now a major doubt to once again be unavailable for the Gunners‚Äô 12:30pm clash at Aston Villa tomorrow ‚Äì live on talkSPORT. Prior to Arsenal‚Äôs biggest game of the season, Partey was ruled out with a muscular problem on the day of the match. Partey, who was in attendance at the Emirates to cheer on his teammates, was replaced by January arrival Jorginho in the lone defensive midfield role. It was the first match that the Ghana international has been unavailable for since Arsenal‚Äòs 3-1 defeat away at Manchester United in September. Speaking to Amazon Prime prior to kick-off, Arteta said of Partey: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs what happens in football. Players pick up injuries. ‚ÄúUnfortunately, Thomas felt something in his back muscle and he wasn‚Äôt available to play today.‚Äù And in his post-match press conference, the Spaniard declared he is unsure when the ex-Atletico Madrid man will be back ahead of the trip to Villa. Pressed for an update on his fitness, Arteta stated: ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt know. It‚Äôs what happens, it‚Äôs part of football. ‚ÄúI think Jorgi played a good game and we have to assess Tommy to see how bad it is.‚Äù Asked how late did he find out that Partey wouldn‚Äôt be able to play against City, Arteta remarked: ‚ÄúVery late. Very, very late.‚Äù A potential spell on the sidelines will be a huge blow for Arsenal, who are in somewhat of a mini-crisis having failed to win any of their last three Premier League games. They have now dropped down into second spot ‚Äì level on points with City ‚Äì though they do have a game in hand over Pep Guardiola‚Äôs men. Arteta‚Äôs side will have to get back to form to make sure they don‚Äôt lose ground on City with the goal difference the only thing separating the two. However, Arsenal do have an advantage if they can stay close to the Citizens as they still have a game in hand. Arsenal‚Äôs game in hand over Man City is at home to Everton on Wednesday, March 1. It will kick off at the Emirates at 7:45 p.m. The fixture was originally due to take place on Saturday, September 10 but was postponed due to the death of Queen Elizabeth II. A win for the Gunners could potentially see them regain the advantage in the title race and move back to the top of the Premier League table. Although they could already be there if they are to better Man City‚Äôs results up until the game in hand is played, in which case, three points against Everton would move them further clear. However, they lost only their second game of the season to the Toffees in Sean Dyche‚Äôs first game in charge of the Merseyside club. So, despite the two teams battling at opposite ends of the table, the clash will definitely not be an easy one for Arteta‚Äôs men. Follow Us

newsArray.title: Forty-two to benefit from NRFF Level 1 Medical, WADA training course
creator: Guardian Nigeria
newsArray.description: No fewer than 42 Nigerians will benefit from the maiden Nigeria Rugby Football Federation (NRFF) Level 1 Medical and WADA Training Course, which began on Wednesday at the Media Centre, Moshood Abiola Stadium, Abuja. The post Forty-two to benefit from NRFF Level 1 Medical, WADA training course appeared first on The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News.
newsArray.content: No fewer than 42 Nigerians will benefit from the maiden Nigeria Rugby Football Federation (NRFF) Level 1 Medical and WADA Training Course, which began on Wednesday at the Media Centre, Moshood Abiola Stadium, Abuja. The federation had earlier organised a seminar and workshop for coaches and referees, where participants were certified to further improve the development of the game in the country. The federation said the three-day medical and anti-doping seminar, which will train officials and other Nigerians, ends on tomorrow with 44 participants from all the geopolitical zones of the country. It said that a World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) accredited educator will educate participants on day one, while Dr. Rotimi Akinola, another WADA accredited educator, will take on the last two days. Speaking on the readiness and gains of the training, president of the federation, Dr. Ademola Are, said: ‚ÄúThe NRFF is ready to receive all the participants. Everything is in place, including the venue and facilitators. It is important that players and coaches are well informed because we don‚Äôt want our players to run foul of the law. ‚ÄúParticipants will be certified after the course and will also be kept abreast of the laws guiding anti-doping, how to avoid them and know what drugs and food players should take or avoid.‚Äù The three-day course will see the Minister of Sports, Sunday Dare and Permanent Secretary of the Ministry, Ismaila Abubakar gracing the occasion. newsArray.title: Trabzonspor fans unveil tifo in support of emergency service workers following earthquake in Turkey
newsArray.description: The 7.8-magnitude earthquake, which struck while people were sleeping, has claimed the lives of more than 41,000 people, according to the latest figures.
newsArray.content: Trabzonspor fans unveil emotional tifo in support of emergency service workers following devastating earthquake in Turkey and Syria... while players celebrate winning goal by standing in solidarity Trabzonspor beat Basel in the first leg of the Europa Conference League play-off Fans unveiled a tifo which showed an emergency service worker rescuing a baby Trabzonspor players celebrated goal by standing in solidarity with a Turkey shirt By Arthur Parashar For Mailonline Published: 00:23, 17 February 2023 | Updated: 01:50, 17 February 2023 e-mail 1 View comments Trabzonspor supporters unveiled an emotional tifo in support of emergency service workers before their clash with Basel following the devastating earthquake in Turkey and Syria . The 7.8-magnitude earthquake, which struck while people were sleeping last week, has claimed the lives of more than 41,000 people, according to the latest figures. Rescue missions are still ongoing - including for former Newcastle and Chelsea player Christian Atsu - but authorities have not revealed how many people are still missing. Trabzonspor announced before the Europa Conference League tie that all proceeds from the game will be donated to the victims. And as the players walked out into the Akyazi Stadium, fans unveiled a special tifo which depicted an emergency service worker rescuing a baby from the rubble. Trabzonspor fans unveiled a tifo in support of emergency service workers in Turkey and Syria Trabzonspor fans thank the emergency services with a tifo before their European clash vs. Basel, after the tragic recent earthquake in T√ºrkiye. pic.twitter.com/7pSepEr8sE ‚Äî Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) February 16, 2023 It also featured a brave Mexican rescue dog called Proteo, who died while performing its duties in Turkey. Meanwhile, the tifo also showed a defiant fist rising through the rubble holding a Turkish flag. The players also wore black armbands and held a minute's silence, while a Basel banner read: 'Our thoughts are with you.' Trabzonspor went on to beat Swiss side Basel 1-0 thanks to a second-half goal from Jens Stryger Larsen. The players celebrated the goal by gathering together and standing in solidarity while holding a Turkey shirt. A goal for T√ºrkiye üáπüá∑ The Trabzonspor team gather on the sidelines to show solidarity after the recent earthquake in the country. #UEL pic.twitter.com/CfyQD8wcin ‚Äî Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) February 16, 2023 It was a visibly emotional day for the home side who were playing despite the Turkish Super Lig being suspended as a result of the quake. Speaking after the game, Trabzonspor manager Abdullah Avci told UEFA.com: 'Football has a power to heal and unite. I'm so glad that we played this game tonight. 'All the Turkish clubs supported us today, and everyone in the country showed their support. It's emotional.' The two sides will meet again next Thursday in Switzerland for the second leg of the Europa Conference League play-offs. newsArray.title: Barcelona 2-2 Man United: Raphinha's late equaliser for the hosts denies Red Devils comeback win
newsArray.description: CHRIS WHEELER: The Manchester United fans were singing tribute songs to Ole Gunnar Solskjaer long after this brilliant, breathless game was over, and it certainly felt like old times.
newsArray.content: Barcelona 2-2 Man United: European giants serve up a THRILLER as Marcus Rashford inspires Red Devils comeback before Raphinha equalises to leave Europa League play-off finely poised Former Leeds star denied Manchester United a first victory against Barcelona at the iconic Nou Camp Marcus Rashford scored his 14th goal in the last 16 games and his fourth in as many matches on the night Re-live the action from the Nou Camp as it happened in the Europa League play-off first leg in Barcelona By Chris Wheeler for the Daily Mail Published: 19:40 GMT, 16 February 2023 | Updated: 01:10 GMT, 17 February 2023 e-mail 1.7k shares 378 View comments Advertisement The Manchester United fans high up in the cavernous Nou Camp were singing tribute songs to Ole Gunnar Solskjaer long after this brilliant, breathless game was over, and it certainly felt like old times. ‚ÄòA bit of a throwback,‚Äô said Paul Scholes on BT Sport. It certainly was. Not only a throwback to Solskjaer‚Äôs unforgettable winner in the 1999 Champions League final victory over Bayern Munich here, but to the days when United and Barcelona were slugging it out for Europe‚Äôs biggest prize. These two clubs don‚Äôt do boring, not even in the Europa League. One of the greatest match-ups in football produced a spectacle befitting its top billing at a packed Nou Camp last night. Marcus Rashford lit up the old place. He was practically unplayable for periods in the second half. Rashford scored one ‚Äì his 14th goal in the last 16 games ‚Äì to bring United level in the second half and created another. Marcos Alonso got the hosts off to a strong start in the second period opening the scoring in the 50th minute of the match Marcus Rashford scored his fourth in as many games just two minutes later to draw the visitors back level An own goal from Jules Kounde then allowed the Red Devils to take the lead just nine minutes after having gone behind Raphinha equalised to make it 2-2 on 76 minutes to deny the visitors a crucial first leg win in the Europa League play-off On the eve of this game, Barca boss Xavi had described Rashford as one of Europe‚Äôs most dangerous strikers and he looked like it, playing in a central role that isn‚Äôt meant to bring out the best in him. Who says? He put United within 14 minutes of beating Barca for the first time ever here. Who knows how this game would have turned out had referee Maurizio Mariani sent off Jules Kounde for a challenge on Rashford when United were still 2-1 up? Contact was made outside the box so no penalty, but Kounde can count himself a lucky boy that the Italian official took no action at all. Having gone ahead through former Chelsea defender Marcos Alonso, Barcelona levelled with a goal from another player familiar to the Premier League, Raphinha, to leave this tie all square going into next week‚Äôs second leg at Old Trafford. What a first leg it was. End to end, blow for blow. Two of Europe‚Äôs greats going at it like there was a Champions League final at stake, not a place in the Europa League last 16. The 94,000 fans in the Nou Camp loved it. United will feel as though they should have headed home with an advantage over what is, to be fair, far from the greatest Barcelona team of all time. But by the end of a pulsating game, it was the Catalans who were looking more likely to score. United came here planning to attack, even though an unfamiliar 4-1-4-1 formation didn‚Äôt necessarily look like it. Erik ten Hag‚Äôs side had Bruno Fernandes on the right and Jadon Sancho switching to the left with, even more strangely, 6ft 6in striker Wout Weghorst playing in midfield. ‚ÄòTactical‚Äô, was Ten Hag‚Äôs explanation and it worked for the most part with Weghorst able to help stifle Frenkie de Jong and Franck Kessie in the middle. The in-form England star equalised for his side in the 52nd minute of the game to continue his own rich purple patch David de Gea was rooted to the spot anticipating a touch from start striker Robert Lewandowski from Raphinha's cross in The sun had barely dipped below the towering banks of the Nou Camp when we got underway, but you quickly forgot that this was a Europa League tie kicking off at 5.45pm in the UK. MATCH FACTS AND PLAYER RATINGS BARCELONA (4-3-3): Ter Stegen 6; Kounde 5, Araujo 6, Alonso 7 (Christensen 67), Alba 6.5 (Balde 67, 6); Pedri 6.5 (Roberto 41, 7), De Jong 7, Kessie 6.5 (Fati 67, 6); Raphinha 7 (F Torres 83), Lewandowski 6.5, Gavi 7.5. Subs: Garcia, Sotorres, Casado, Torre, Tenas, Alarcon. Scorers: Alonso 50, Raphinha 76 Booked: Alba, Gavi Manager: Xavi Hernandez 7 MAN UTD (4-1-4-1): De Gea 6; Wan-Bissaka 6.5, Varane 6.5, Shaw 7, Malacia 6 ; Casemiro 6; Fernandes 6.5, Weghorst 5.5, Fred 7, Sancho 5 (Garnacho 82); Rashford 8. Subs: Lindelof, Maguire, Dalot, Heaton, Pellistri, Butland, Elanga, Garnacho, Iqbal, Mainoo. Scorers: Rashford 52, Kounde og 59 Booked: Varane, Casemiro, Malacia Manager: Erik ten Hag 7 Referee: Maurizio Mariani (Italy) 7 <!- - ad: https://mads.dailymail.co.uk/v8/de/sport/football/article/other/mpu_factbox.html?id=mpu_factbox_1 - -> Advertisement Fred was inches away from getting on the end of Fernandes‚Äô cross in the opening 20 seconds and that set the tone. Barcelona responded as David de Gea beat away an effort from Robert Lewandowski, and Alonso and Jordi Alba both fired over. United created the best chances before half-time, however, with Marc-Andre ter Stegen denying Weghorst and Rashford. If the first half was entertaining, the second was a belter. Barca went ahead in the 50th minute when former Leeds favourite Raphinha swung a corner towards the back post where Alonso had already taken up position after peeling away from Fred. The United midfielder had got his body shape all wrong and was facing the wrong way entirely by the time Alonso rose to plant a downward header past inside De Gea‚Äôs near post. United roared straight back and equalised just two minutes later. Fred atoned by slipping a pass in between Alba and Alonso, the latter chasing Rashford as he broke into the box. United‚Äôs in-form striker looked to have taken the ball too wide with his first touch, and a cross seemed like the better option. But Rashford is playing with so much confidence at the moment that he fancied his chances, and rifled a shot past Ter Stegen at his near post. The England man was instrumental again when United took the lead seven minutes later. Luke Shaw played a short corner to Rashford and, again, the easier option seemed to be to take the ball to the left, away from Raphinha. Instead, Rashford suddenly dipped to the right where there was almost no space and beat his man before racing along the byeline. He crossed to the edge of the six-yard box where Fernandes helped the ball on and Kounde bundled the ball over his own goal line. Erik ten Hag said before the game that he wanted his side to take Barcelona out of their 'comfort zone' at the Nou Camp more videos 1 2 3 Watch video Xavi plotting to nullify top talent Marcus Rashford Watch video Erik ten Hag and Luke Shaw speak ahead of Man U clash with Barcelona Watch video Xavi and Ten Hag react to thrilling encounter between Utd and Barcelona Watch video Sort Out Your Life team declutters and organises 'regular' home Watch video Video shows never-before seen Titanic footage of human dive in 1986 Watch video Robert Ballard speaks on 1986 Titanic Exploration Expedition dive Watch video Nicola dive expert: 'I would have changed my whole search strategy' Watch video Storm Otto: Met Office warns of strong winds of 70 mph to hit UK Watch video TikT-oker demonstrates tongue exercises she used for defined jaw Watch video Researchers claim Russia's war could push millions more into poverty Watch video Live cam captures birth of two rare tiger cubs at Chester zoo Watch video Woman tells Prue Leith how her parents chose their death However, this is a Barcelona side unbeaten in their last 17 games now and they weren‚Äôt done yet. When Casemiro played an uncharacteristically poor pass on the edge of his own box in the 746th minute, the ball was intercepted and played out to Raphinha. He whipped in a cross and the presence of Lewandowski only seemed to confuse United as the Pole failed to get a touch on the ball which flew through Raphael Varane‚Äôs legs and past De Gea. Casemiro almost went one better ‚Äì or worse ‚Äì when he directed the ball against his own post in the frantic, dying moments. So we head back to Old Trafford to do it all again next week. What a treat. newsArray.title: Paul Scholes praises Marcus Rashford after Manchester United star continued excellent form
newsArray.description: Rashford is full of confidence at present and the Manchester United star made a significant impact in the 2-2 draw with Barcelona in the Europa League.
newsArray.content: 'His all round game at the moment is nothing short of BRILLIANT': Paul Scholes praises Marcus Rashford after Manchester United star continued his excellent form against Barcelona Paul Scholes was full of praise for Marcus Rahsford's all-round game Rashford scored again as Manchester United drew 2-2 against Barcelona Owen Hargreaves feels Rashford won't fear going up against any defender By Jeorge Bird For Mailonline Published: 20:07 EST, 16 February 2023 | Updated: 20:08 EST, 16 February 2023 e-mail 41 shares View comments Paul Scholes has hailed Marcus Rashford for being 'absolutely brilliant' this season. Rashford is full of confidence at present and the Manchester United star made a significant impact in the 2-2 draw with Barcelona in the Europa League as he scored and also played a major part in Jules Kounde 's own goal. So far this season Rashford has scored 22 goals for United, matching his best ever tally from the 2019-20 campaign. Asked on BT Sport whether Rashford is one of the best finishers in the world, United legend Scholes said: 'He is at this point. This season he's been absolutely brilliant. You'd like to see it over the next four or five years if he's going to get to the levels of the really top players in the world. 'But tonight to come to Barcelona to come to this stadium, great atmosphere. It was a bit wild there, that's probably one of his better chances, but his all round play, his ability to go past people, his movement, the goal. He's got the power to do that. His all round game at the moment is nothing short of brilliant.' Paul Scholes praised Marcus Rashford, describing his all-round game as 'absolutely brilliant' Manchester United legend Scholes agreed Rashford is one of the best finishers at present Another former United player, Owen Hargreaves, also spoke fondly of Rashford. Hargreaves stated that given the way in which he is playing, Rashford will feel that he can get the better of any defender at present. In addition, Hargreaves feels that Rashford is capable of having a significant impact in different positions. Hargreaves said: 'I like to see him in different positions. He loves running off the left, Ten Hag played him quite central today. All the goals came off the right hand side. If he's allowed to drift I don't think you can stop him. 'I don't think he looks at any defender and sees any fear. Kounde's a great athlete, Araujo's a terrific athlete, but Marcus I don't think he had any fear whoever was in front of him. If he's positive and runs forward, I think he thinks he can beat anyone right now.' Rashford was on the scoresheet again in United's 2-2 Europa League draw against Barcelona Owen Hargreaves believes that Rashford won't be fearful of facing any defender at present Rashford will hope to keep making a major impact for United until the end of the campaign as the club look to end their wait for a trophy. In addition to their involvement in the Europa League, United are through to the final of the Carabao Cup, where they will take on Newcastle, while they are home to West Ham in the FA Cup fifth round. They are currently third in the Premier League, six points behind leaders Manchester City. newsArray.title: Black Queens begin camping ahead of two international friendlies
creator: GNA
newsArray.description: News Ghana, Latest Updates and Breaking News of Ghana, GNA, https://newsghana.com.gh/black-queens-begin-camping-ahead-of-two-international-friendlies/Nora Hauptle, Head Coach of Ghana‚Äôs senior female side, Black Queens has begun training with thirty-four selected players at the Ghanaman Soccer of Excellence ahead of friendlies against Benin and Togo respectively. This was part of the Ghana Football Association‚Äôs effort to reshape the senior side to its glory days and also prepare them for [‚Ä¶] News Ghana, Latest Updates and Breaking News of Ghana, GNA, https://newsghana.com.gh/black-queens-begin-camping-ahead-of-two-international-friendlies/
newsArray.content: Nora Hauptle, Head Coach of Ghana‚Äôs senior female side, Black Queens has begun training with thirty-four selected players at the Ghanaman Soccer of Excellence ahead of friendlies against Benin and Togo respectively. This was part of the Ghana Football Association‚Äôs effort to reshape the senior side to its glory days and also prepare them for international competitions. The players were taken through an intensive training session in Prampram to keep up with their fitness level and also learn some tactical skills going into the clash against their West African opponents. The players were made up of both foreign-based players and some local players selected from the 20 Premier League clubs in Ghana. Black Queens would depart Accra on Friday to Cotonou as they face Benin on February 19, 2023, after which they would take on Togo on February 25, 2023. The selected players are Abdulai Salamatu, Acheampong Juliet, Achiaa Anasthesia, Adubea Princella, Alhassan Adama, Amponsah Ophelia, Anima Naomi, Animah Grace, Appiah Martha, Asantewaa Grace, Atovor Edem, Evelyn Badu, Boaduwaa Doris, Boakye Portia, and Bugre Azumah. The rest are Buoadu Grace, Darkwaa Veronica, Egyir Janet, Eshun Linda, Fuseini Salamatu, Haruna Zeinab, Issaka Lauratu, Konlan Cynthia, McCarthy Kerrie, Nyame Mafia, Nyamekye Stella, Osei Victoria, Osei Gifty, Owusu Jacqueline, Owusu Princess, Salifu Safiatu, Teye Suzzy Dede, Tuah Perpetual and Yakubu Fiduos.

newsArray.title: Bad Business: Orlando Pirates really fumbled the Lyle Foster bag
creator: James Freemantle
newsArray.description: Orlando Pirates missed out on a huge financial windfall when Lyle Foster secured his record-breaking switch to Burnley. Here are the details.
newsArray.content: Orlando Pirates missed out on a massive windfall when Lyle Foster secured his big-money move to Burnley. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at the situation. RIVAL WATCH: Kaizer Chiefs to be haunted by one of their own? ICYMI: Lyle Foster officially the most expensive South African footballer in history Orlando Pirates miss massive Lyle Foster windfall The fee that Burnley paid to Belgian side Westerlo for Foster‚Äôs services could rise to ‚Ç¨10 million. That depends on whether the Clarets secure promotion to the Premier League, but it‚Äôs looking good for Vincent Kompany‚Äôs side. So, how did the Buccaneers miss out on a chunk of that cash? PSL: Predicting the Orlando Pirates XI vs Maritzburg LOL: Five things that didn‚Äôt exist when Kaizer Chiefs last won a trophy Pirates fumbled the bag big time According to FIFA rules, a club that developed an U23 player is obliged to accrue a payment for every international transfer that the player makes. Pirates waived their share of future sell-on fees in the case of Lyle Foster, however, when the now 22-year-old moved to Monaco back in 2019. The Ligue 1 Principality side paid R20 million for Foster back then, which is a tiny proportion of the ‚Ç¨10 million (R194 million) that Burnley shelled out for the talented Bafana striker. The Pirates board will be having sleepless nights over that decision. An elementary business mistake really. ONCE ALWAYS: Proof that Lyle Foster will always be an Orlando Pirates fan ICYMI: Three Orlando Pirates players that Kaizer Chiefs fans would love to sign What are your thoughts, Bucs fans? For more insights, analysis and love for the beautiful game, hit up James Freemantle. Meanwhile, follow The South African on Twitter for up-to-the-minute news updates.

newsArray.title: Kaizer Chiefs to be haunted by one of their own?
creator: James Freemantle
newsArray.description: Kaizer Chiefs will be praying that they don't get eliminated from the Nedbank Cup by one of their own. A big decision has been made.
newsArray.content: A Kaizer Chiefs loanee eligible to play for Casric FC in the Nedbank Cup last 16 against his parent club. Could that spell danger for Amakhosi? LOL: Five things that didn‚Äôt exist when Kaizer Chiefs last won a trophy THROWBACK: Top stars to play for both Kaizer Chiefs and Orlando Pirates Amakhosi influence at Casric is strong Casric FC are one of the most exciting teams in the second tier of South African football. They‚Äôre clearly benefiting from the loan system which has seen them acquire a number of Kaizer Chiefs stars on a temporary basis. ‚ÄúTough one, it‚Äôs going to be an interesting one, but very good for football, I think the Nedbank Cup is giving all clubs an opportunity even in the lower divisions, talented players get to be seen and spotted by big teams,‚Äù coach Arthur Zwane said at Naturena on Thursday. Former Chiefs Head of Development Sundra Govinder is performing admirably alongside co-owner and head coach Bucs Mthombeni. Assistant duo Thabo Nthethe and Paulus Masehe are also chipping in. This technical team has propelled Casric to the summit of the NFD table with promotion to the PSL now a realistic dream. THROWBACK: Three Kaizer Chiefs youngsters destined for greatness Kaizer Chiefs keen to see Sifama progress It‚Äôs no surprise to see the likes of Kgotso Molope and loanee Sifama excelling with Casric, such is the high-quality environment surrounding them. iDiski Times have confirmed that Chiefs will not block Sifama from facing them in the Nedbank Cup, and Zwane has reiterated that. He‚Äôs excited to see Sifama evolve as a footballer but isn‚Äôt underestimating the task at hand. ICYMI: Pitso Mosimane has bigger fish to fry than Kaizer Chiefs flop Khama Billiat ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great for the country and for the league itself, so yeah it‚Äôs going to be a very difficult game for us ‚Äì they are number one as we speak, so that alone tells you they are a good team, they are not there by mistake,‚Äù the Amakhosi coach continued in praise of Casric. ‚ÄúPeople might see it as a team that‚Äôs easy to beat but no we will have to dig deep again because they have hard runners when you look at their team, very difficult to play against. ‚ÄúSo apart from the players we loaned to them, they are just a good team, we won‚Äôt take them for granted and we will need to show our superiority. They will play against us.‚Äù RIVAL WATCH: Predicting the Orlando Pirates XI vs Maritzburg Amakhosi fans will be delighted to see young Sifama progressing and maturing as a goal-scorer. However, they might not enjoy it so much if he‚Äôs the one to eliminate them from the Nedbank Cup this season. Thoughts, Chiefs fans? For more insights, analysis and love for the beautiful game, hit up James Freemantle. Meanwhile, follow The South African on Twitter for up-to-the-minute news updates.

newsArray.title: ALM derby violence no distraction for Victory, City
creator: Shayne Hope
newsArray.description: Melbourne Victory coach Tony Popovic and Melbourne City counterpart Rado Vidosic say their players are focused ahead of an A-League Men derby.
newsArray.content: Arch-rivals Melbourne Victory and Melbourne City insist they have moved on from the darkest day in A-League Men history as they prepare to lock horns for the first time since December's violent pitch invasion. The round-eight derby was abandoned after just 21 minutes as fans stormed the AAMI Park pitch during an emotion-charged fixture amid protests against the A-Leagues' controversial decision to play grand finals in Sydney for the next three years. Referee Alex King was injured and a television cameraman was hurt when struck by a flare, while City goalkeeper Tom Glover suffered concussion and lacerations to the face when hit with a metal bucket. The drama has cast a dark shadow over last-placed Victory's horror campaign, with $550,000 in fines and crowd restrictions among the sanctions handed down by Football Australia. The threat of a 10-point deduction - to be imposed if there is further crowd trouble within the next three-and-a-half seasons - still hangs over the club ahead of Saturday night's clash at AAMI Park. "No one's ignoring it (but) we've all moved on from that," Victory coach Tony Popovic said. "I don't know if the players are speaking about it internally but we're not addressing it as a group. "We're happy to see our fans and members back, (and) we want that to continue." City led December's derby through a well-crafted Aiden O'Neill goal before the match was called off. They have since gone on to build a commanding eight-point lead over Central Coast at the top of the table, with a game in hand, and coach Rado Vidosic is adamant his players are focused on the task at hand. "We are not going to talk about the 'memorable' things," Vidosic said, in reference to the pitch invasion. "We will show some of the clips from the (previous derby) game, some of our attacking combination play. We scored a beautiful goal. "We had several other good opportunities in the first 20 minutes but also they had a couple of chances as well. "It's a derby, the form and position on the table never really make a big difference. It's going to be who does better on the day." Victory have managed just one win in eight matches since the abandoned derby but four fresh faces brought in during the transfer window have boosted hopes of a turnaround in fortunes. Damien Da Silva, Connor Chapman and Bruce Kamau all featured in last week's defeat away to Newcastle and could be joined by Fernando Romero in the side to face City. The Paraguyan striker - on loan from Primera Division outfit Cerro Porteno - is a chance to make his Victory debut off the bench as Popovic urges his side to use the derby as a springboard back into finals contention. "We feel we're very close to turning this," Popovic said. "There's no better night or no better game to do it than in a derby. "We're up against the best (and) that's a fantastic challenge. We know we're good enough to win the game. "Instead of talking about it, we have to show it in our performance. "If we bring out the best performance I think we can really show Melbourne City what a good team we are." Sign up for our emails

newsArray.title: WAFL 2023: Perth chase former Geelong midfielder Quinton Narkle as Essendon, Richmond VFL also in the hunt
creator: Mitchell Woodcock
newsArray.description: Perth are competing against two VFL sides for the signature of former Geelong midfielder Quinton Narkle after he did not get a spot on Richmond‚Äôs list.
newsArray.content: Perth are competing against two VFL sides for the signature of former Geelong midfielder Quinton Narkle after he did not get a spot on Richmond‚Äôs list. Narkle, 25, trained with the Tigers over the summer but was overlooked in favour of country forward Kaelan Bradtke, who was also set to play for Perth if he did not get a gig in the AFL. The AFL‚Äôs Supplementary Selection Period closed on Wednesday, meaning Narkle must now wait until the mid-season draft to add to his 41 games for the Cats. Staff writers Craig O'Donoghue The West Australian understands both Richmond and Essendon‚Äôs VFL sides want Narkle to play for them this season, with the midfielder weighing up his future based on his family. ‚ÄúQuinton came back from the Christmas break in career-best condition and impressed us with his character and commitment to our program,‚Äù Richmond national recruiting manager Matt Clarke said. ‚ÄúUnfortunately we did not have two spots available, so we needed to make a very hard decision. He couldn‚Äôt have done any more during his time training at the club.‚Äù Meanwhile, troubled former AFL star Sydney Stack is committed to playing for the Demons, having hit the track in their past eight sessions. Stack, 22, is set to be an important part of the Demons‚Äô midfielder in 2023 as they seek a return to finals under new coach Peter German. Perth have also denied reports Sam Stubbs is unlikely to play for them in 2023, saying they‚Äôre off the mark. Stubbs has met with the club twice this week and is set to be at the club on Friday night after missing out on a spot on Fremantle‚Äôs list this year after training with them all summer. There were reports Stubbs did not want to play for Perth and even could play amateurs, but a Demons official shot them down and said the forward was committed to the club. Sign up for our emails

newsArray.title: Again, Partey may miss Arsenal‚Äôs clash with Aston Villa
creator: Guardian Nigeria
newsArray.description: Arsenal Manager, Mikel Arteta, has not given a return date for Thomas Partey after the midfielder missed out on Arsenal‚Äôs defeat to Manchester City with an injury. The post Again, Partey may miss Arsenal‚Äôs clash with Aston Villa appeared first on The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News.
newsArray.content: Arsenal Manager, Mikel Arteta, has not given a return date for Thomas Partey after the midfielder missed out on Arsenal‚Äôs defeat to Manchester City with an injury. The 29-year-old is now a major doubt to once again be unavailable for the Gunners‚Äô 12:30pm clash at Aston Villa tomorrow ‚Äì live on talkSPORT. Prior to Arsenal‚Äôs biggest game of the season, Partey was ruled out with a muscular problem on the day of the match. Partey, who was in attendance at the Emirates to cheer on his teammates, was replaced by January arrival Jorginho in the lone defensive midfield role. It was the first match that the Ghana international has been unavailable for since Arsenal‚Äòs 3-1 defeat away at Manchester United in September. Speaking to Amazon Prime prior to kick-off, Arteta said of Partey: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs what happens in football. Players pick up injuries. ‚ÄúUnfortunately, Thomas felt something in his back muscle and he wasn‚Äôt available to play today.‚Äù And in his post-match press conference, the Spaniard declared he is unsure when the ex-Atletico Madrid man will be back ahead of the trip to Villa. Pressed for an update on his fitness, Arteta stated: ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt know. It‚Äôs what happens, it‚Äôs part of football. ‚ÄúI think Jorgi played a good game and we have to assess Tommy to see how bad it is.‚Äù Asked how late did he find out that Partey wouldn‚Äôt be able to play against City, Arteta remarked: ‚ÄúVery late. Very, very late.‚Äù A potential spell on the sidelines will be a huge blow for Arsenal, who are in somewhat of a mini-crisis having failed to win any of their last three Premier League games. They have now dropped down into second spot ‚Äì level on points with City ‚Äì though they do have a game in hand over Pep Guardiola‚Äôs men. Arteta‚Äôs side will have to get back to form to make sure they don‚Äôt lose ground on City with the goal difference the only thing separating the two. However, Arsenal do have an advantage if they can stay close to the Citizens as they still have a game in hand. Arsenal‚Äôs game in hand over Man City is at home to Everton on Wednesday, March 1. It will kick off at the Emirates at 7:45 p.m. The fixture was originally due to take place on Saturday, September 10 but was postponed due to the death of Queen Elizabeth II. A win for the Gunners could potentially see them regain the advantage in the title race and move back to the top of the Premier League table. Although they could already be there if they are to better Man City‚Äôs results up until the game in hand is played, in which case, three points against Everton would move them further clear. However, they lost only their second game of the season to the Toffees in Sean Dyche‚Äôs first game in charge of the Merseyside club. So, despite the two teams battling at opposite ends of the table, the clash will definitely not be an easy one for Arteta‚Äôs men. Follow Us

newsArray.title: Forty-two to benefit from NRFF Level 1 Medical, WADA training course
creator: Guardian Nigeria
newsArray.description: No fewer than 42 Nigerians will benefit from the maiden Nigeria Rugby Football Federation (NRFF) Level 1 Medical and WADA Training Course, which began on Wednesday at the Media Centre, Moshood Abiola Stadium, Abuja. The post Forty-two to benefit from NRFF Level 1 Medical, WADA training course appeared first on The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News.
newsArray.content: No fewer than 42 Nigerians will benefit from the maiden Nigeria Rugby Football Federation (NRFF) Level 1 Medical and WADA Training Course, which began on Wednesday at the Media Centre, Moshood Abiola Stadium, Abuja. The federation had earlier organised a seminar and workshop for coaches and referees, where participants were certified to further improve the development of the game in the country. The federation said the three-day medical and anti-doping seminar, which will train officials and other Nigerians, ends on tomorrow with 44 participants from all the geopolitical zones of the country. It said that a World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) accredited educator will educate participants on day one, while Dr. Rotimi Akinola, another WADA accredited educator, will take on the last two days. Speaking on the readiness and gains of the training, president of the federation, Dr. Ademola Are, said: ‚ÄúThe NRFF is ready to receive all the participants. Everything is in place, including the venue and facilitators. It is important that players and coaches are well informed because we don‚Äôt want our players to run foul of the law. ‚ÄúParticipants will be certified after the course and will also be kept abreast of the laws guiding anti-doping, how to avoid them and know what drugs and food players should take or avoid.‚Äù The three-day course will see the Minister of Sports, Sunday Dare and Permanent Secretary of the Ministry, Ismaila Abubakar gracing the occasion. newsArray.title: Trabzonspor fans unveil tifo in support of emergency service workers following earthquake in Turkey
newsArray.description: The 7.8-magnitude earthquake, which struck while people were sleeping, has claimed the lives of more than 41,000 people, according to the latest figures.
newsArray.content: Trabzonspor fans unveil emotional tifo in support of emergency service workers following devastating earthquake in Turkey and Syria... while players celebrate winning goal by standing in solidarity Trabzonspor beat Basel in the first leg of the Europa Conference League play-off Fans unveiled a tifo which showed an emergency service worker rescuing a baby Trabzonspor players celebrated goal by standing in solidarity with a Turkey shirt By Arthur Parashar For Mailonline Published: 00:23, 17 February 2023 | Updated: 01:50, 17 February 2023 e-mail 1 View comments Trabzonspor supporters unveiled an emotional tifo in support of emergency service workers before their clash with Basel following the devastating earthquake in Turkey and Syria . The 7.8-magnitude earthquake, which struck while people were sleeping last week, has claimed the lives of more than 41,000 people, according to the latest figures. Rescue missions are still ongoing - including for former Newcastle and Chelsea player Christian Atsu - but authorities have not revealed how many people are still missing. Trabzonspor announced before the Europa Conference League tie that all proceeds from the game will be donated to the victims. And as the players walked out into the Akyazi Stadium, fans unveiled a special tifo which depicted an emergency service worker rescuing a baby from the rubble. Trabzonspor fans unveiled a tifo in support of emergency service workers in Turkey and Syria Trabzonspor fans thank the emergency services with a tifo before their European clash vs. Basel, after the tragic recent earthquake in T√ºrkiye. pic.twitter.com/7pSepEr8sE ‚Äî Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) February 16, 2023 It also featured a brave Mexican rescue dog called Proteo, who died while performing its duties in Turkey. Meanwhile, the tifo also showed a defiant fist rising through the rubble holding a Turkish flag. The players also wore black armbands and held a minute's silence, while a Basel banner read: 'Our thoughts are with you.' Trabzonspor went on to beat Swiss side Basel 1-0 thanks to a second-half goal from Jens Stryger Larsen. The players celebrated the goal by gathering together and standing in solidarity while holding a Turkey shirt. A goal for T√ºrkiye üáπüá∑ The Trabzonspor team gather on the sidelines to show solidarity after the recent earthquake in the country. #UEL pic.twitter.com/CfyQD8wcin ‚Äî Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) February 16, 2023 It was a visibly emotional day for the home side who were playing despite the Turkish Super Lig being suspended as a result of the quake. Speaking after the game, Trabzonspor manager Abdullah Avci told UEFA.com: 'Football has a power to heal and unite. I'm so glad that we played this game tonight. 'All the Turkish clubs supported us today, and everyone in the country showed their support. It's emotional.' The two sides will meet again next Thursday in Switzerland for the second leg of the Europa Conference League play-offs. newsArray.title: Barcelona 2-2 Man United: Raphinha's late equaliser for the hosts denies Red Devils comeback win
newsArray.description: CHRIS WHEELER: The Manchester United fans were singing tribute songs to Ole Gunnar Solskjaer long after this brilliant, breathless game was over, and it certainly felt like old times.
newsArray.content: Barcelona 2-2 Man United: European giants serve up a THRILLER as Marcus Rashford inspires Red Devils comeback before Raphinha equalises to leave Europa League play-off finely poised Former Leeds star denied Manchester United a first victory against Barcelona at the iconic Nou Camp Marcus Rashford scored his 14th goal in the last 16 games and his fourth in as many matches on the night Re-live the action from the Nou Camp as it happened in the Europa League play-off first leg in Barcelona By Chris Wheeler for the Daily Mail Published: 19:40 GMT, 16 February 2023 | Updated: 01:10 GMT, 17 February 2023 e-mail 1.7k shares 378 View comments Advertisement The Manchester United fans high up in the cavernous Nou Camp were singing tribute songs to Ole Gunnar Solskjaer long after this brilliant, breathless game was over, and it certainly felt like old times. ‚ÄòA bit of a throwback,‚Äô said Paul Scholes on BT Sport. It certainly was. Not only a throwback to Solskjaer‚Äôs unforgettable winner in the 1999 Champions League final victory over Bayern Munich here, but to the days when United and Barcelona were slugging it out for Europe‚Äôs biggest prize. These two clubs don‚Äôt do boring, not even in the Europa League. One of the greatest match-ups in football produced a spectacle befitting its top billing at a packed Nou Camp last night. Marcus Rashford lit up the old place. He was practically unplayable for periods in the second half. Rashford scored one ‚Äì his 14th goal in the last 16 games ‚Äì to bring United level in the second half and created another. Marcos Alonso got the hosts off to a strong start in the second period opening the scoring in the 50th minute of the match Marcus Rashford scored his fourth in as many games just two minutes later to draw the visitors back level An own goal from Jules Kounde then allowed the Red Devils to take the lead just nine minutes after having gone behind Raphinha equalised to make it 2-2 on 76 minutes to deny the visitors a crucial first leg win in the Europa League play-off On the eve of this game, Barca boss Xavi had described Rashford as one of Europe‚Äôs most dangerous strikers and he looked like it, playing in a central role that isn‚Äôt meant to bring out the best in him. Who says? He put United within 14 minutes of beating Barca for the first time ever here. Who knows how this game would have turned out had referee Maurizio Mariani sent off Jules Kounde for a challenge on Rashford when United were still 2-1 up? Contact was made outside the box so no penalty, but Kounde can count himself a lucky boy that the Italian official took no action at all. Having gone ahead through former Chelsea defender Marcos Alonso, Barcelona levelled with a goal from another player familiar to the Premier League, Raphinha, to leave this tie all square going into next week‚Äôs second leg at Old Trafford. What a first leg it was. End to end, blow for blow. Two of Europe‚Äôs greats going at it like there was a Champions League final at stake, not a place in the Europa League last 16. The 94,000 fans in the Nou Camp loved it. United will feel as though they should have headed home with an advantage over what is, to be fair, far from the greatest Barcelona team of all time. But by the end of a pulsating game, it was the Catalans who were looking more likely to score. United came here planning to attack, even though an unfamiliar 4-1-4-1 formation didn‚Äôt necessarily look like it. Erik ten Hag‚Äôs side had Bruno Fernandes on the right and Jadon Sancho switching to the left with, even more strangely, 6ft 6in striker Wout Weghorst playing in midfield. ‚ÄòTactical‚Äô, was Ten Hag‚Äôs explanation and it worked for the most part with Weghorst able to help stifle Frenkie de Jong and Franck Kessie in the middle. The in-form England star equalised for his side in the 52nd minute of the game to continue his own rich purple patch David de Gea was rooted to the spot anticipating a touch from start striker Robert Lewandowski from Raphinha's cross in The sun had barely dipped below the towering banks of the Nou Camp when we got underway, but you quickly forgot that this was a Europa League tie kicking off at 5.45pm in the UK. MATCH FACTS AND PLAYER RATINGS BARCELONA (4-3-3): Ter Stegen 6; Kounde 5, Araujo 6, Alonso 7 (Christensen 67), Alba 6.5 (Balde 67, 6); Pedri 6.5 (Roberto 41, 7), De Jong 7, Kessie 6.5 (Fati 67, 6); Raphinha 7 (F Torres 83), Lewandowski 6.5, Gavi 7.5. Subs: Garcia, Sotorres, Casado, Torre, Tenas, Alarcon. Scorers: Alonso 50, Raphinha 76 Booked: Alba, Gavi Manager: Xavi Hernandez 7 MAN UTD (4-1-4-1): De Gea 6; Wan-Bissaka 6.5, Varane 6.5, Shaw 7, Malacia 6 ; Casemiro 6; Fernandes 6.5, Weghorst 5.5, Fred 7, Sancho 5 (Garnacho 82); Rashford 8. Subs: Lindelof, Maguire, Dalot, Heaton, Pellistri, Butland, Elanga, Garnacho, Iqbal, Mainoo. Scorers: Rashford 52, Kounde og 59 Booked: Varane, Casemiro, Malacia Manager: Erik ten Hag 7 Referee: Maurizio Mariani (Italy) 7 <!- - ad: https://mads.dailymail.co.uk/v8/de/sport/football/article/other/mpu_factbox.html?id=mpu_factbox_1 - -> Advertisement Fred was inches away from getting on the end of Fernandes‚Äô cross in the opening 20 seconds and that set the tone. Barcelona responded as David de Gea beat away an effort from Robert Lewandowski, and Alonso and Jordi Alba both fired over. United created the best chances before half-time, however, with Marc-Andre ter Stegen denying Weghorst and Rashford. If the first half was entertaining, the second was a belter. Barca went ahead in the 50th minute when former Leeds favourite Raphinha swung a corner towards the back post where Alonso had already taken up position after peeling away from Fred. The United midfielder had got his body shape all wrong and was facing the wrong way entirely by the time Alonso rose to plant a downward header past inside De Gea‚Äôs near post. United roared straight back and equalised just two minutes later. Fred atoned by slipping a pass in between Alba and Alonso, the latter chasing Rashford as he broke into the box. United‚Äôs in-form striker looked to have taken the ball too wide with his first touch, and a cross seemed like the better option. But Rashford is playing with so much confidence at the moment that he fancied his chances, and rifled a shot past Ter Stegen at his near post. The England man was instrumental again when United took the lead seven minutes later. Luke Shaw played a short corner to Rashford and, again, the easier option seemed to be to take the ball to the left, away from Raphinha. Instead, Rashford suddenly dipped to the right where there was almost no space and beat his man before racing along the byeline. He crossed to the edge of the six-yard box where Fernandes helped the ball on and Kounde bundled the ball over his own goal line. Erik ten Hag said before the game that he wanted his side to take Barcelona out of their 'comfort zone' at the Nou Camp more videos 1 2 3 Watch video Xavi plotting to nullify top talent Marcus Rashford Watch video Erik ten Hag and Luke Shaw speak ahead of Man U clash with Barcelona Watch video Xavi and Ten Hag react to thrilling encounter between Utd and Barcelona Watch video Sort Out Your Life team declutters and organises 'regular' home Watch video Video shows never-before seen Titanic footage of human dive in 1986 Watch video Robert Ballard speaks on 1986 Titanic Exploration Expedition dive Watch video Nicola dive expert: 'I would have changed my whole search strategy' Watch video Storm Otto: Met Office warns of strong winds of 70 mph to hit UK Watch video TikT-oker demonstrates tongue exercises she used for defined jaw Watch video Researchers claim Russia's war could push millions more into poverty Watch video Live cam captures birth of two rare tiger cubs at Chester zoo Watch video Woman tells Prue Leith how her parents chose their death However, this is a Barcelona side unbeaten in their last 17 games now and they weren‚Äôt done yet. When Casemiro played an uncharacteristically poor pass on the edge of his own box in the 746th minute, the ball was intercepted and played out to Raphinha. He whipped in a cross and the presence of Lewandowski only seemed to confuse United as the Pole failed to get a touch on the ball which flew through Raphael Varane‚Äôs legs and past De Gea. Casemiro almost went one better ‚Äì or worse ‚Äì when he directed the ball against his own post in the frantic, dying moments. So we head back to Old Trafford to do it all again next week. What a treat. newsArray.title: Paul Scholes praises Marcus Rashford after Manchester United star continued excellent form
newsArray.description: Rashford is full of confidence at present and the Manchester United star made a significant impact in the 2-2 draw with Barcelona in the Europa League.
newsArray.content: 'His all round game at the moment is nothing short of BRILLIANT': Paul Scholes praises Marcus Rashford after Manchester United star continued his excellent form against Barcelona Paul Scholes was full of praise for Marcus Rahsford's all-round game Rashford scored again as Manchester United drew 2-2 against Barcelona Owen Hargreaves feels Rashford won't fear going up against any defender By Jeorge Bird For Mailonline Published: 20:07 EST, 16 February 2023 | Updated: 20:08 EST, 16 February 2023 e-mail 41 shares View comments Paul Scholes has hailed Marcus Rashford for being 'absolutely brilliant' this season. Rashford is full of confidence at present and the Manchester United star made a significant impact in the 2-2 draw with Barcelona in the Europa League as he scored and also played a major part in Jules Kounde 's own goal. So far this season Rashford has scored 22 goals for United, matching his best ever tally from the 2019-20 campaign. Asked on BT Sport whether Rashford is one of the best finishers in the world, United legend Scholes said: 'He is at this point. This season he's been absolutely brilliant. You'd like to see it over the next four or five years if he's going to get to the levels of the really top players in the world. 'But tonight to come to Barcelona to come to this stadium, great atmosphere. It was a bit wild there, that's probably one of his better chances, but his all round play, his ability to go past people, his movement, the goal. He's got the power to do that. His all round game at the moment is nothing short of brilliant.' Paul Scholes praised Marcus Rashford, describing his all-round game as 'absolutely brilliant' Manchester United legend Scholes agreed Rashford is one of the best finishers at present Another former United player, Owen Hargreaves, also spoke fondly of Rashford. Hargreaves stated that given the way in which he is playing, Rashford will feel that he can get the better of any defender at present. In addition, Hargreaves feels that Rashford is capable of having a significant impact in different positions. Hargreaves said: 'I like to see him in different positions. He loves running off the left, Ten Hag played him quite central today. All the goals came off the right hand side. If he's allowed to drift I don't think you can stop him. 'I don't think he looks at any defender and sees any fear. Kounde's a great athlete, Araujo's a terrific athlete, but Marcus I don't think he had any fear whoever was in front of him. If he's positive and runs forward, I think he thinks he can beat anyone right now.' Rashford was on the scoresheet again in United's 2-2 Europa League draw against Barcelona Owen Hargreaves believes that Rashford won't be fearful of facing any defender at present Rashford will hope to keep making a major impact for United until the end of the campaign as the club look to end their wait for a trophy. In addition to their involvement in the Europa League, United are through to the final of the Carabao Cup, where they will take on Newcastle, while they are home to West Ham in the FA Cup fifth round. They are currently third in the Premier League, six points behind leaders Manchester City. creator: GNA
newsArray.description: News Ghana, Latest Updates and Breaking News of Ghana, GNA, https://newsghana.com.gh/black-queens-begin-camping-ahead-of-two-international-friendlies/Nora Hauptle, Head Coach of Ghana‚Äôs senior female side, Black Queens has begun training with thirty-four selected players at the Ghanaman Soccer of Excellence ahead of friendlies against Benin and Togo respectively. This was part of the Ghana Football Association‚Äôs effort to reshape the senior side to its glory days and also prepare them for [‚Ä¶] News Ghana, Latest Updates and Breaking News of Ghana, GNA, https://newsghana.com.gh/black-queens-begin-camping-ahead-of-two-international-friendlies/
newsArray.content: Nora Hauptle, Head Coach of Ghana‚Äôs senior female side, Black Queens has begun training with thirty-four selected players at the Ghanaman Soccer of Excellence ahead of friendlies against Benin and Togo respectively. This was part of the Ghana Football Association‚Äôs effort to reshape the senior side to its glory days and also prepare them for international competitions. The players were taken through an intensive training session in Prampram to keep up with their fitness level and also learn some tactical skills going into the clash against their West African opponents. The players were made up of both foreign-based players and some local players selected from the 20 Premier League clubs in Ghana. Black Queens would depart Accra on Friday to Cotonou as they face Benin on February 19, 2023, after which they would take on Togo on February 25, 2023. The selected players are Abdulai Salamatu, Acheampong Juliet, Achiaa Anasthesia, Adubea Princella, Alhassan Adama, Amponsah Ophelia, Anima Naomi, Animah Grace, Appiah Martha, Asantewaa Grace, Atovor Edem, Evelyn Badu, Boaduwaa Doris, Boakye Portia, and Bugre Azumah. The rest are Buoadu Grace, Darkwaa Veronica, Egyir Janet, Eshun Linda, Fuseini Salamatu, Haruna Zeinab, Issaka Lauratu, Konlan Cynthia, McCarthy Kerrie, Nyame Mafia, Nyamekye Stella, Osei Victoria, Osei Gifty, Owusu Jacqueline, Owusu Princess, Salifu Safiatu, Teye Suzzy Dede, Tuah Perpetual and Yakubu Fiduos.

newsArray.title: Bad Business: Orlando Pirates really fumbled the Lyle Foster bag
creator: James Freemantle
newsArray.description: Orlando Pirates missed out on a huge financial windfall when Lyle Foster secured his record-breaking switch to Burnley. Here are the details.
newsArray.content: Orlando Pirates missed out on a massive windfall when Lyle Foster secured his big-money move to Burnley. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at the situation. RIVAL WATCH: Kaizer Chiefs to be haunted by one of their own? ICYMI: Lyle Foster officially the most expensive South African footballer in history Orlando Pirates miss massive Lyle Foster windfall The fee that Burnley paid to Belgian side Westerlo for Foster‚Äôs services could rise to ‚Ç¨10 million. That depends on whether the Clarets secure promotion to the Premier League, but it‚Äôs looking good for Vincent Kompany‚Äôs side. So, how did the Buccaneers miss out on a chunk of that cash? PSL: Predicting the Orlando Pirates XI vs Maritzburg LOL: Five things that didn‚Äôt exist when Kaizer Chiefs last won a trophy Pirates fumbled the bag big time According to FIFA rules, a club that developed an U23 player is obliged to accrue a payment for every international transfer that the player makes. Pirates waived their share of future sell-on fees in the case of Lyle Foster, however, when the now 22-year-old moved to Monaco back in 2019. The Ligue 1 Principality side paid R20 million for Foster back then, which is a tiny proportion of the ‚Ç¨10 million (R194 million) that Burnley shelled out for the talented Bafana striker. The Pirates board will be having sleepless nights over that decision. An elementary business mistake really. ONCE ALWAYS: Proof that Lyle Foster will always be an Orlando Pirates fan ICYMI: Three Orlando Pirates players that Kaizer Chiefs fans would love to sign What are your thoughts, Bucs fans?
